enWisdom: Victory is [attained] by prudence, and prudence comes through experience
Experience bears the fruit of learning
The intelligent person is one who is admonished by experiences
Indeed only he is intelligent who is admonished by experiences
In every experience there is an admonition

Wisdom: كَفَى عِظَةً لِذَوِي الْأَلْبَابِ مَا جَرَّبُوا
enWisdom: For the people who possess intellect, what they experience is sufficient as an admonition

Wisdom: أَمْلَكُ النَّاسِ لِسَدَادِ الرَّأْيِ كُلُّ مُجَرِّبٍ
enWisdom: The ones who possess most pertinent opinions are those who have experience
The fruit of experience is making the right choice
One who lacks experience is [easily] deceived
One who experiences, increases in judiciousness
One whose experiences increase, his negligence decreases

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحْكَمَ التَّجَارِبَ سَلِمَ مِنَ الْمَعَاطِبِ
enWisdom: One who consolidates the experiences [he has had] will be safe from danger

Wisdom: مَنْ غَنِيَ عَنِ التَّجَارِبِ عَمِيَ عَنِ الْعَوَاقِبِ
enWisdom: One who discards experiences becomes blind to the consequences [of his actions]
